intro: Erigeron andersonii, commonly known as the Anderson's fleabane, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble daisies. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, such as rocky soils and open woodlands. Its flowers are usually white or pale blue, with ray florets surrounding a central disc of tubular flowers. Erigeron andersonii is often found in disturbed areas and is adapted to thrive in low-nutrient soils.
